title: Create questionnaire
text: main element whole functionality shiny.survey. R6 class definition used create objects creating Shiny modules upon initialization. takes source questions (optionally: additional instruction descriptions individual inputs) generates whole questionnaire UI. Within created module entire backend reactivity contained (consisting answers validation output). Generally, basic dataflow within process shown figure . Logic quetzio_server object

what: What is the structure of question source?
title: Create questionnaire
text: seen figure , three possible sources questions: - googlesheets (needs googlesheets4 package installed) - yaml (needs yaml package installed) - R object (list data.frame) one source method can used. needs defined initialization specifying source_method argument call quetzio_server$new() source, every shinyInput can specify following parameters: inputId type label mandatory: (true/false) input must filled width: regular input specification. provided, defaults 500px Bold ones mandatory! Additionally, various supported shinyInput types support additional parameters. Table supported shinyInputs possible parameters provided : Italic parameters interchangeable. can specify either choices choiceValues choiceNames single input. also multiple-value parameters. Bold x indicates parameter mandatory need specified given shinyInput

previous_headings: What is the structure of question source?
title: Create questionnaire
text: main intended way sourcing data module creating YAML source file simple form - template shown . also requires installation yaml R package inputId don’t need specified parameter, need provided name sequence
code: inputId_1:    type: shinyInput_type    label: shinyInput_label    parameter_1: value    parameter_2: value    parameter_n: value inputId_2:    type: shinyInput_type    label: shinyInput_label    parameter: value    multi-value_parameter:      - value_1      - value_2      - value_n inputId_n: ...

previous_headings: What is the structure of question source?
title: Create questionnaire
text: Additional way sourcing data, especially useful intend frequently update questions multiple people collaborating run Shiny application. use method googlesheets4 R package needs installed. can create example googlesheet using helper function provided package. makes sure needed columns present containing correct classes. can see, contains one placeholder row exemplary values correct types. can populate googlesheet using Google Drive GUI - remember remove placeholder row! Values multi-values parameters need separated within one cell either semicolon newline
code:
# assignement to hold the ID of created googlesheet id <- create_quetzio_source(   method = "gsheet")  # see the data structure: str(   googlesheets4::read_sheet(ss = id, sheet = "Questions")   ) #> tibble [1 × 16] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ inputId          : chr "placeholder" #>  $ type             : chr "textInput" #>  $ mandatory        : logi TRUE #>  $ label            : chr "Remove before production" #>  $ width            : chr "500px" #>  $ chr_placeholder  : chr "some text" #>  $ num_value        : num 1 #>  $ num_min          : num 0 #>  $ num_max          : num 2 #>  $ num_step         : num 0.5 #>  $ mult_choices     : chr "Something
Else
More" #>  $ mult_choiceValues: chr "1
2
3" #>  $ mult_choiceNames : chr "One
Two
Three" #>  $ mult_selected    : chr "NULL" #>  $ select_maxItems  : num 1 #>  $ radio_inline     : logi TRUE  # I remove the googlesheet created for this presentation googledrive::drive_trash(id)

previous_headings: What is the structure of question source?
what: providing R object as a source (source_method == 'raw')
title: Create questionnaire
text: , reason can’t won’t install yaml googlesheets4 packages just prefer assigning created R object source, can provide either list data.frame initialization new quetzio_server object. analogous structure yaml (list) googlesheet (data.frame) source file. can check correct structure two-item example questionnaire configured list data.frame . list recommended source, though long questionnaires similiar shinyInput types data.frame source can easier generate - depends workflow structure questionnaire
code:
# every nested list need to be named with the inputId list_source <- list(   textItem = list(     type = "textInput",     label = "First input",     placeholder = "Write inside of me, please!"),   selectizeItem = list(     type = "selectizeInput",     label = "Choose up to two",     choices = c("I am first", "I am second", "I am third", "Who am I?"),     maxItems = 2,     mandatory = TRUE   ) )  # data.frame can be configured explicitly by 'data.frame' df_source <- data.frame(   inputId = c("textItem", "selectizeItem"),   type = c("textInput", "selectizeInput"),   mandatory = c(NA, TRUE),   label = c("First input", "Choose up to two"),   chr_placeholder = c("Write inside of me, please!", NA),   mult_choices = c(NA, "I am first;I am second;I am third;Who am I?"),   select_maxItems = c(NA, 2) )  # You can also use the same function as for googlesheet generation to generate # example data.frame with placeholder row, though you need to modify it # afterwards  df_source2 <- create_quetzio_source(method = "df") str(df_source2) #> 'data.frame':    1 obs. of  16 variables: #>  $ inputId          : chr "placeholder" #>  $ type             : chr "textInput" #>  $ mandatory        : logi TRUE #>  $ label            : chr "Remove before production" #>  $ width            : chr "500px" #>  $ chr_placeholder  : chr "some text" #>  $ num_value        : num 1 #>  $ num_min          : num 0 #>  $ num_max          : num 2 #>  $ num_step         : num 0.5 #>  $ mult_choices     : chr "Something
Else
More" #>  $ mult_choiceValues: chr "1
2
3" #>  $ mult_choiceNames : chr "One
Two
Three" #>  $ mult_selected    : chr "NULL" #>  $ select_maxItems  : num 1 #>  $ radio_inline     : logi TRUE

title: Create questionnaire
text: need create quetzio_server object inside server code. following mandatory arguments quetzio_server$new() source_method == 'yaml': source_yaml source_method == 'gsheet': source_gsheet_id source_gsheet_sheetname source_method == 'raw': source_object module_id: character string reference created module create questionnaire based source created :
code: quetzio_from_list <- quetzio_server$new(   source_method = "raw",   source_object = list_source,   module_id = "my_questionnaire" )

what: Using the built-in googlesheets output method
title: Create questionnaire
text: wish send results survey automatically googlesheet file, can specify additional arguments quetzio_server$new(). can see , assignement object isn’t necessary. don’t allow reading state questionnaire getting asnwers application. example , answers saved external googlesheet, answer reading won’t necessary.
code: # the same questionnaire as above quetzio_server$new(   source_method = "raw",   source_object = list_source,   module_id = "my_questionnaire",   # but with specific arguments for the googlesheet output   output_gsheet = TRUE,   output_gsheet_id = "your_googlesheet_id",   output_gsheet_sheetname = "sheet_name" )

what: Reading the state of the created quetzio_server object within the application.
title: Create questionnaire
text: can get information questionnaire calling following calls object:
code: # All of the above are 'reactiveVal' object, so they need to be  # accessed in the observe() or reactive() context observe({      # is the questionnaire done: TRUE or FALSE   my_questionnaire$is_done()    # check if there are any warning messages: if none, then NULL   my_questionnaire$message()    # get the list of answers. If questionnaire isn't done, then NULL   my_questionnaire$answers() })

title: Create questionnaire
text: One optional features quetzio_server ability generate multi-paragraph instructions item descriptions questionnaire. elements instruction /item description need provide correct config, describing following element types: instruction_title: generates h1 tag instruction_para: generates p tag instruction_list: generates ul ol tag elements pasted together given order within div css class quetzioInstruction. located just first question. item_desc: generates item description, appear item label input contained within div css class quetzioDescription Following parameters can provided element (mandatory!): mandatory every element type optional: specified, default FALSE every element type instruction_list optional: specified, default ‘left’ every element type instruction_list optional: specified, default FALSE instruction_list mandatory, item_desc

title: Create questionnaire
text: Needs yaml R package installed, passed desc_yaml argument initialization quetzio_server object. form similiar one YAML question source, sequences don’t need named:
code: -   type: some_element_type   text: content_of_element   additional_parameter: value -   type: type_of_second_element   text: content_of_second   parameter_1: value   parameter_n: value

title: Create questionnaire
text: Needs googlesheet4 R package installed. googlesheet id need passed desc_gsheet_id, sheetname desc_gsheet_sheetname arguments initialization quetzio_server object. form similar one googlesheet question source. can also created helper function.
code: # assignement to hold the ID of created googlesheet id <- create_desc_source( method = "gsheet") # see the data structure: str( googlesheets4::read_sheet(ss = id, sheet = "Descriptions") ) #> tibble [1 × 6] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #> $ type : chr "placeholder" #> $ align : chr "left" #> $ html : logi TRUE #> $ order : logi TRUE #> $ inputId: chr "placeholder" #> $ text : chr "Delete this example" # I remove the googlesheet created for this presentation googledrive::drive_trash(id)

title: Create questionnaire
text: Analogous R object source questions, can provide form list dataframe. pass object desc_object argument quetzio_server initialization:
code: # nested list don't need to be named! list_source <- list( list( type = "instruction_title", text = "I am the title of this questionnaire", html = TRUE, align = "center"), list( type = "instruction_list", choices = c("I am first", "I am second", "I am third", "Who am I?"), order = TRUE ) ) # data.frame can be configured explicitly by 'data.frame' df_source <- data.frame( type = c("instruction_title", "instruction_list"), text = c("I am the title of this questionnaire", "I am first;I am second;I am third;Who am I?"), html = c(TRUE, NA), align = c("center", NA), order = c(NA, TRUE) ) # You can also use the same function as for googlesheet generation to generate # example data.frame with placeholder row, though you need to modify it # afterwards df_source2 <- create_desc_source(method = "df") str(df_source2) #> 'data.frame': 1 obs. of 6 variables: #> $ type : chr "placeholder" #> $ align : chr "left" #> $ html : logi TRUE #> $ order : logi TRUE #> $ inputId: chr "placeholder" #> $ text : chr "Delete this example"

title: Create questionnaire
text: feel like needs stated shiny.survey isn’t option creating questionnaires Shiny. main alternative shinysurveys package. Main difference embedding - shiny.surveys can used create questionnaire (multiple ) within complex Shiny application, shinysurverys tailored create whole ShinyApp . also currently (0.2.0.) doesn’t offer built-support googlesheets4, either source data collection.

what: Create a survey module in ShinyApp
title: Create a survey module in ShinyApp
text: package includes way create survey using various Shiny widgets source file: either local YAML file, GoogleSheet net. Results surveys send GoogleSheet choice. completely handled R6 shiny modules, easy include even multiple independend questionnaires ShinyApp keep code clean!

title: Create a survey module in ShinyApp
text: can install development version shiny.survey GitHub :

title: Create a survey module in ShinyApp
text: current stage development shiny.survey package consists two exported R6 classes used server corresponding functions bind UI shinyApp: * quetzio_server create single questionnaire quetzio_UI input UI questionnaire. Questionnaires moment handles type inputs: - textInput - numericInput - selectizeInput - radioButtons quetzio_link_server link multiple semi-independent questionnaires quetzio_link_UI bind connected UI.

title: Create a survey module in ShinyApp
text: ’s usage straigtforward: Simply add quetzio_server object shinyApp server() call, quetzio_UI ui: Additionally, ShinyApp can monitor questionnaire status react fully customizable! also possibility link questionnaires way, appear one another. now needed configure calls accordingly:
code: ui <- fluidPage(   quetzio_UI("yaml_module"),   quetzio_UI("gsheet_module") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {  # YAML generated survey with output automatically saved to googlesheets  yaml_quetzio <- quetzio_server$new(   source_method = "yaml",   source_yaml = "some_yaml",   output_gsheet_id = "googlesheet_id",   output_gsheet_sheetname = "sheet_name_with_questions",   module_id = "yaml_module" )  # survey generated from googlesheet source, with output automatically saved to # googlesheets  gsheet_quetzio <- quetzio_server$new(   source_method = "gsheet",   source_gsheet_id = "googlesheet_id",   source_gsheet_sheetname = "sheet_name_with_questions",   # you don't need to specify another googlesheet file to save answers   # If you don't specify it, the class assumes it is the same as source one   output_gsheet_id = "another_googlesheet_id",   output_gsheet_sheetname = "sheet_name_with_answers",   module_id = "gsheet_module" )  } # trigger some action after the questionnaire is completed   observe({     req(yaml_quetzio$is_done())     showModal(       modalDialog("You're done!")     )   })  # catch the answers provided to the questionnaire   output$gsheet_answers <- renderPrint(     gsheet_quetzio$answers()   ) ui <- fluidPage(   quetzio_link_UI("modules_link") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {  # Linked questionnaires - one generated from yaml, second from googlesheets.  # Their output won't be automatically saved to googlesheets in this example # (though it is possible to set - their internal reactivity is independent # to the quetzio_link in that regard)    quetzio_link <- quetzio_link_server$new(     yaml_quetzio = quetzio_server$new(       source_method = "yaml",       source_yaml = "some_yaml",       module_id = "yaml_module"     ),     gsheet_quetzio = quetzio_server$new(       source_method = "gsheet",       source_gsheet_id = "googlesheet_id",       source_gsheet_sheetname = "sheet_name_with_questions",       module_id = "gsheet_module"     ),     link_id = "modules_link"   )    # and you can also trigger things based on the completion rate      # trigger some action after the link is 50% completed and after completion   # of both questionnaires   observe({     if (quetzio_link$completion() == 0.5) {       showModal(         modalDialog("You're half done!")       )     } else if (quetzio_link$completion() == 1) {       showModal(         modalDialog("You're completely done!")       )     }   })  # catch the answers provided to the questionnaire   output$all_answers <- renderPrint(     quetzio_link$answers()   )  }

title: Update label of the shinyInput — .update_label
text: New function used handle input label update two reasons. Firstly, specific update*Input functions need called specific input types, create need verbose code multiple strategies. Secondly - important - update*Input functions allow supplementing labels 'HTML' tags, everything passed label coerced character. shinyjs::html() remedies problem.

text: quetzio_name character vector indicating questionnaire questions update located trigger reactive trigger update. needs take values linked changes source source_method character string specifying form source config file provided. Can either 'gsheet', 'yaml' 'raw'. Necessity arguments dependent choice. info see 'details' source_yaml path source yaml file source_gsheet_id id source googlesheet file source_gsheet_sheetname name source spreadsheet source_object object class list (similiar structure 'yaml' source) data.frame (similiar structure 'googlesheet' source) source questions. can create sample data.frame create_survey_source(). Needed source_method == 'raw'

title: Quetzio Server class — quetzio_server
code: quetzio_server$new(   source_method,   source_yaml = NULL,   source_yaml_default = NULL,   source_gsheet_id = NULL,   source_gsheet_sheetname = NULL,   source_object = NULL,   output_gsheet = FALSE,   output_gsheet_id = NULL,   output_gsheet_sheetname = NULL,   desc_yaml = NULL,   desc_gsheet_id = NULL,   desc_gsheet_sheetname = NULL,   desc_object = NULL,   module_id = NULL,   div_id = NULL,   custom_css = NULL,   button_labels = c("Submit", "Cannot submit", "Submitted!", "Error occured!"),   render_ui = TRUE,   link_id = NULL )

title: Quetzio Server class — quetzio_server
text: source_method character string specifying form source config file provided. Can either 'gsheet', 'yaml' 'raw'. Necessity arguments dependent choice. info see 'details' source_yaml path source yaml file source_yaml_default path optional default options items generated 'source_yaml' file. source_method == 'yaml'. source_gsheet_id id source googlesheet file source_gsheet_sheetname name source spreadsheet source_object object class list (similiar structure 'yaml' source) data.frame (similiar structure 'googlesheet' source) source questions. can create sample data.frame create_survey_source(). Needed source_method == 'raw' output_gsheet logical: wish save answers automatically googlesheet. TRUE, 'output_gsheet_id' 'output_gsheet_sheetname' arguments need specified. Defaults FALSE output_gsheet_id id output googlesheet file. specified, googlesheet 'source' used output_gsheet_sheetname name output spreadsheet desc_yaml path optional instruction item descriptions. desc_gsheet_id id googlesheet provide optional instruction item descriptions. Defaults 'source_gsheet_id', provided. desc_gsheet_sheetname name source optional instruction item descriptions. desc_object object class list data.frame source optional instruction item descriptions. module_id character string unique id module. specified, automatically generated div_id character string unique id created div. specified, set 'form' custom_css custom css classes 'mandatory star' 'invalid_input'. specified, default look used: invalid_input = "outline: red; outline-style: dashed; outline-offset: 10px;" mandatory_star = "color: red;" button_labels character vector length four labels submit button states. Defaults : c('Submit', 'submit', 'Submitted!', 'Error occured!') render_ui logical indicating UI questionnaire rendered link_id character specifying 'link_id' 'quetzio_link_server' object, modifying namespace. used internally, questionnaire part linked server. set manually.

title: Quetzio Server class — quetzio_server
text: Currently, multiple methods source, generate inputs, output. Mandatory arguments change depending choices: source: source_method == 'yaml': 'source_yaml' source_method == 'gsheet': 'source_gsheet_id,' 'source_gsheet_sheetname' source_method == 'raw': 'source_object' output: output_gsheet == TRUE: 'output_gsheet_id' ('source_gsheet_id') 'output_gsheet_sheetname' also optional functionalities, can used sources. optional instructions item descriptions - generated one following provided: desc_yaml: rendering YAML file desc_gsheet_sheetname: rendering googlesheet. source_method gsheet 'googlesheet_id' containing description different source, desc_gsheet_id need provided desc_object: rendering R object classes 'data.frame' 'list' optional default configuration - used type shinyInput. Need provide source_yaml_default - methods ATM.

title: shiny.survey 0.0.3
text: First production-ready version. Added NEWS.md file track changes package.

title: shiny.survey 0.0.4
text: Rebuilding whole system modules Begin rebranding shiny.quetzio Removal survey_module object creating quetzio_server R6 object quetzio_UI function

title: shiny,survey 0.0.5
text: Added working R6 object link multiple questionnaires created quetzio_server corresponding UI function quetzio_link_UI Logic behing parsing css ‘.invalid_input’ ‘.mandatory_star’ also redone. now easier implement allows independent looks (based div_id given questionnaire) googlesheets4 needed taking source gsheet putting output gsheet yaml needed taking source YAML file

title: shiny.survey 0.0.6
text: Made link_id render_ui arguments linked quetzio_server modules set automatically: need specify automatically !

title: shiny.survey 0.0.7
text: selectizeInputs works better: default using selectize.js multiple = TRUE, allows empty initial value. Instead specifying multiple, user can now specify maxItems, indicates many items can specified. left NULL, allows selecting options. default invalid_input css style changed color: red; font-style: italic;

title: shiny.survey 0.0.8
text: moved quetzio_list quetzio_link_server private public. now easier access separate questionnaires works also questionnaires linked quetzio_link_server, though call need made quetzio_server directly within observer: observe(quetzio_link_object$quetzio_list[['quetzio_name']]$update_labels(...)) wrapper function functionality considered

title: shiny.survey 0.0.9
text: added update_labels method quetzio_link_server class polished documentation code update_labels methods fixed bug ‘mandatory star’ disappearing mandatory items label gets updated

title: shiny.survey 0.0.10
text: support populating data default values added, source_yaml_default argument quetzio_server class initialization
